questions.question: The International Cricket Council (ICC) was originally founded as the Imperial Cricket Conference in 1909.
The first Cricket World Cup was held in England in 1975.
Australia was one of the founding members of the ICC.
The ICC changed its name from Imperial Cricket Conference to International Cricket Conference in 1965.
The first Test match was played between England and Australia in 1877.
South Africa was a founding member of the ICC in 1909.
The ICC headquarters has always been located in Dubai.
Women's cricket World Cup was first held before the men's T20 World Cup.
The ICC gained its current name 'International Cricket Council' in 1989.
Kerry Packer's World Series Cricket had no impact on ICC cricket in the 1970s.
